topics.body:
Not to sound like a asshole, but I've learned a valuable lesson: some people just don't fucking care if something is dangerous and in a life or death situation it's better to let them injure themselves than put everyone in a dangerous situation.

You know the sort of people; where their ego is more important than anything.


I got in a fight on july 4th cause my brother was letting his kids light blackcats (the type of fireworks that kill people) and they were holding them then throwing them and my family got angry at me for saying something.  If someone is holding a explosive in their hands like it's a sparkler and yelling at you telling you to shut up they're not the sort of people that can survive in situations where you have to think smart not think with your ego.

Tl:dr; Wheel of morality turn, turn, turn.  Tell us the lesson that we should learn, "If someone's ego is more important than survival skills then chances are they wouldn't make it in a situation where they have to set their ego aside for the sake of living".

Tl:dr of Tl:dr; Some people just don't care if something will kill them cause having their ego intact is more important than living to them.
